did.abstract: These are copies of out-going letters written from Maryland and principally concern family affairs, financial conditions, health, and life in Maryland. There are some references to Maryland politics.

odd.head: Early American History Not
odd.p: This Charles Willson Peale letterbook for 1745-1747 is the earliest of Peale's letterbooks. It is separate from his other letterbooks because this one is a facsimile of an original, whereas the others held at the APS are all originals. This earlier volume reflects Peale's early life in Maryland and touches on various aspects of his life there, including discussions of his social life and of local politics.

odd.head: Administrative Note
odd.p: This record is superseded by, and included in, B P31. It was marked “internal only” in Dec., 2010 and is being kept in the case that it is needed for future administrative needs.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Charles Peale, father of Charles Willson Peale, was a schoolmaster and painter.
